summary:
Irish, or Gaeilge, is a Celtic language spoken mainly in Ireland. It was the primary language until the 1800s when English became more popular. Today, around 72,000 people in Ireland speak Irish daily, mostly in areas called Gaeltacht. 

The language has a long history, with an ancient writing system called Ogham. It has three main dialects and a standardized written form. Irish is an official language in the Republic of Ireland, Northern Ireland, and the European Union. It's also spoken by some Irish Americans.
title: Irish language
